title.text: Using NOMLEX to Produce Nominalization Patterns for Information Extraction

abstractContent.text: This paper describes how NOMLEX, a dictionary of nominalizations, can be used in Information Extraction (IE).

This paper details a procedure which maps syntactic and semantic information designed for writing an IE pattern for an active clause (IBM appointed Alice Smith as vice president) into a set of patterns for nominaliza-tions (e.g., IBM's appointment of Alice Smith as vice president and Alice Smith's appointment as vice president).

introductionContent.text: Although, nominalizationQ are very common in written text, the computational linguistics literature provides few systematic accounts of how to deal with phrases containing these words.
This paper focuses on this problem in the context of Information Extraction (IE).

However, this mechanism does not extend to nominalization patterns, which must be coded separately from the clausal patterns.
